intro: Microstegium eucnemis, commonly known as the slender wood sorrel, is a flowering plant native to eastern North America. It belongs to the family Oxalidaceae and is characterized by its small, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shady habitats such as woodlands and stream banks. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Microstegium eucnemis is often found in association with other woodland flora and is a common component of the understory in mixed hardwood forests.
